message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.CC, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of detecting network structures in distributed computing, which is a central topic in the area of distributed computing (cs.DC). The specific problem studied is the detection of cliques in the CONGEST model, which is a classic problem in graph theory and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also deals with limited communication bandwidth, which is a common constraint in networked systems (cs.NI). The lower bound result is obtained using a reduction to the set disjointness problem in two-party communication complexity, which is a well-studied area in theoretical computer science (cs.CC). Finally, the paper also presents a communication protocol for listing all cliques in the input graph, which involves information theory and coding techniques (cs.IT).
